caption:
The photograph captures a relaxed moment of a man lounging outdoors. The man is reclining comfortably in a folding chair with a floral pattern. He is dressed casually in a yellow collared shirt, blue jeans, and black boots, and he is wearing a white cowboy hat. His right arm is positioned over his head, lending a relaxed posture, while he seems to be taking a nap or resting his eyes.

The setting appears to be a public outdoor area, perhaps a park, with well-maintained grass. In the background, there's a substantial tree trunk and a building with a white brick wall. Notably, the wall has the word "PLEASE" in bold, capitalized letters painted on it, adding a curious element to the scene.

The overall mood of the photograph is peaceful and leisurely, suggesting a quiet, sunny day where one can enjoy a moment of calm in a public setting.
title: Black man enjoying a nap on a chaise lounge on Chicago's south side.  From 1960 to 1970 the percentage of Chicago blacks with an income of $7,000 or more jumped from 26 to 58%.  Median black income during the period increased from $4,700 to $7,883, but the dollar gap between their group and the whites actually widened
